sentences.en: "You are rude and obtrusive, Mr Galbraith," said Tommy.
sentences.cn: “您粗暴无礼而且冒失莽撞，加尔布雷思先生，”汤米说道。

sentences.en: Fred keeps cracking rude jokes with the guests.
sentences.cn: 弗雷德不停地和客人们开着粗俗的玩笑。

sentences.en: He can be quite stand-offish and rude, even to his friends.
sentences.cn: 他有时会很冷淡，很粗鲁，甚至对自己的朋友也是如此。

sentences.en: He's rude to her friends and obsessively jealous.
sentences.cn: 他对她的朋友很无礼而且嫉妒心重。

sentences.en: I can be very rude to motorists who hoot at me.
sentences.cn: 对那些朝我按喇叭的司机我会很不客气。

sentences.en: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.cn: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

sentences.en: I just think it's rude and it's ticking me off.
sentences.cn: 我就是觉得这样太粗鲁，叫我很生气。

sentences.en: I was often rude and ungracious in refusing help.
sentences.cn: 我拒绝接受帮助的时候时常显得粗鲁无礼。

sentences.en: Luke made a rude gesture with his finger.
sentences.cn: 卢克用手指做了个下流的手势。

sentences.en: Rude taxi drivers clocked up a total of 239 offences in 1990.
sentences.cn: 1990年，出租车司机鲁莽驾驶导致的违章事件总共达239起。

sentences.en: She was often downright rude to him.
Sometimes people were quite stunningly rude to him.
sentences.cn: 有时人们对他非常粗暴。

sentences.en: Staff are often discourteous and sometimes downright rude.
sentences.cn: 职员常常态度很不礼貌，有时候极其蛮横。

sentences.en: They went around painting rude slogans on cars.
sentences.cn: 他们到处在汽车上涂写粗鲁的标语。

sentences.en: Unfair bosses and rude customers make us unhappy on the job.
sentences.cn: 不公正的老板和粗鲁的顾客让我们工作起来很不愉快。
沃利斯经常粗鲁得让人讨厌。

trans.tran_cn: 粗鲁的，下流的，突然的，简陋的
trans.tran_en: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people
